SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: WILHELM SCHUHR

2. Your address: PIONEER LODGE

3. Date: ASSINIBOIA

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): STATE OF NORTH DAKOTA

5. What was your father's name and occupation? JOSEPH SCHURR FARMER

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): APRIL 1912

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible:

   NORTH DAKOTA

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.) 24 YEARS OLD

9. What were your reasons for coming West? TO HOMESTEAD

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) THROUGH ONE OF MY NEIGHBOURS

11. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

   I AM WISHING
SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: WILLIAM SCHUNK
2. Your address: PIONEER LODGE
3. Date: ASSINIBOIA
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): STATE OF NORTH DAKOTA
5. What was your father's name and occupation? JOSEPH SCHUNK FARMER
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): APRIL 1912
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible:
   NORTH DAKOTA
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)
9. What were your reasons for coming West? TO HOME STUDY
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) THE OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   My friends thought I was crazy because I was going North to a cold country.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   Two friends.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   Rail Road.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)
   When we arrived at Maple Creek we walked 27 miles as there was no one in from that part of that country and it was snowing all the way we walked out. It was +10 above zero in the fall of November when I filed on my homestead.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
   I moved out to the homestead right away.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   Big Stick Lake.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
   North Dakota.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   Farming.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

My friends thought I was crazy because I was going North for a couple of weeks.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

Two friends.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Train.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

When we arrived at Maple Creek, we tracked 20 miles. There was no one in town that part of the country and it was snowing all the way we walked out. It was about zero in the fall and November when I arrived on my homestead.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

To the homestead right away.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

Stick Lake.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

North Dakota.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

Farming.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   TO MY BROTHER ONCE A MONTH

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.
   LYDIA FRENZ. DECEMBER 14TH, 1909.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?
   TWO FRIENDS

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.
   HOME

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?
   TRAVELLING 34 MILES TO THE HOMESTEAD
   MY EXPERIENCE WHEAT TO HAPUE CREEK
   AND HAULING

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?
   ATTEND CHURCH 9 MILES BY HORSE & BUGGY
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

To my brother Oliver in Heidelberg.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

Lydia Frenz, December 14, 1899.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?

Two friends.

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

1700 E.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

My experience traveling west to Haphe Creek and homesteading.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

Attended church 9 times, traveled by horse and buggy.
25. When was the first car used in the community? MODEL T FORD

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make? OCTOBER 1916

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home? MAPLE CREEK 34 MILES

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.) NO MOVE WEST TO POST OFFICE CLIFTONVILLE

MY TOWN WAS HATTON

29. How often did you shop in the early days? ONCE A MONTH

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays? THEY MOSTLY WENT IN ON FRIDAY AND STAYED UNTIL SATURDAY

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

BY MAIL ORDER

32. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, Post Offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give: (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name, (2) origin and meaning of the name, (3) date of its adoption, (4) any changes in names since the first name was given, date and reason for change.

33. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?

IN 1921 IT WAS A RURAL TELEPHONE

34. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

I MADE THE DECISION IN 1915
25. When was the first car used in the community? In 1917.

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make? Ford.

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home? Maple Creek.

34 miles.

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.) No, because of the office in Cliff Temple.

My town was Hatton.

29. How often did you shop in the early days? Once a month.

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays? They mostly went in 1910 and stayed until Saturday.

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

Mail order by Eaton's.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?

In 1917 AT & T was a Rural Telephone.

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

I made the decision in 1915.
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?

Most of the people moved into town because they were carpenters & blacksmiths.

35. Did many people move away during the 1930's? Did many return?

I was one that moved away.

(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library?

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

My daughter holds office in Ochaw in experimental farm as book keeper.

Her name: Mrs. R. Sherren

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district mention it here giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, combine, organizing the first lodge, etc.)

Helen Naple Creek
